abstract:
For a graph $G=(V,E)$ and positive integer $p$, the exact distance-$p$ graph $G^{[
atural p]}$ is the graph with vertex set $V$ and with an edge between vertices $x$ and $y$ if and only if $x$ and $y$ have distance $p$. Recently, there has been an effort to obtain bounds on the chromatic number $\chi(G^{[
atural p]})$ of exact distance-$p$ graphs for $G$ from certain classes of graphs. In particular, if a graph $G$ has tree-width $t$, it has been shown that $\chi(G^{[
atural p]}) \in \mathcal{O}(p^{t-1})$ for odd $p$, and $\chi(G^{[
atural p]}) \in \mathcal{O}(p^{t}\cdot \Delta(G))$ for even $p$. We show that if $G$ is chordal and has tree-width $t$, then $\chi(G^{[
atural p]}) \in \mathcal{O}(p)$ for odd $p$, and $\chi(G^{[
atural p]}) \in \mathcal{O}(p\cdot \Delta(G))$ for even $p$.
